src:
'फिफ्टी-फिफ्टी'साठी अडून बसलेल्या शिवसेनेला छगन भुजबळांचा मोलाचा सल्ला!
शरद पवार यांच्या निवासस्थानी राष्ट्रवादीच्या प्रमुख नेत्यांची आज बैठक सुरू आहे.
02 Nov 2019, 10:44 by ऑनलाइन लोकमत
मुंबई : राज्यातील सत्तासंघर्षावर राष्ट्रवादी काँग्रेसचे नेते छगन भुजबळ यांनी शिवसेनाला एक मोलाचा सल्ला दिला आहे. छगन भुजबळ यांनी शिवसेनेला मुख्यमंत्री पदासाठी अडून राहण्याची 'हीच ती वेळ' असल्याचे म्हटले आहे. 
राष्ट्रवादी काँग्रेसचे अध्यक्ष शरद पवार यांच्या निवासस्थानी राष्ट्रवादीच्या प्रमुख नेत्यांची आज बैठक सुरू आहे. या बैठकीला जाताना प्रसार माध्यमांशी बोलताना छगन भुजबळ यांनी राज्यातील सत्तासंघर्षावर आपली प्रतिक्रिया दिली आहे. यावेळी शिवसेनेसाठी हीच ती वेळ आहे. त्यांनी आपल्या मागणीवर ठाम राहिले पाहिजे, असे छगन भुजबळ यांनी म्हटले आहे. या बैठकीला जयंत पाटील, अजित पवार, छगन भुजबळ, सुप्रिया सुळे, सुनील तटकरे, दिलीप वळसे पाटील, धनंजय मुंडे उपस्थित आहेत. 
दरम्यान, विधानसभा निवडणुकीत महायुतीला स्पष्ट बहुमत मिळाल्यानंतरही अद्याप राज्यात सरकार स्थापन झाले नाही. भाजपा आणि शिवसेना यांच्यातील सत्ता स्थापनेचा तिढा अद्याप सुटला नाही. सत्तेत महत्त्वाचा वाटा मिळावा, यासाठी रस्सीखेच सुरू असल्याचे दिसून येत आहे. 
मुख्यमंत्रीपदासह सत्तेत समान वाटा पाहिजे, म्हणून शिवसेना अडून बसली आहे. तर भाजपानेही आक्रमक होत मुख्यमंत्रीपदावर कोणतीही तडजोड करायची नाही, यावर ठाम भूमिका घेतली आहे. तर, दुसरीकडे राष्ट्रवादी काँग्रेसने विरोधी पक्ष म्हणून काम करणार असल्याचे आधीच जाहीर केले आहे.
text:
In Marconne, Bernard Fusillier has been dedicated to pigeons for 50 years
02 Nov 2019, 10:17 by Mauricette Faÿ

For half a century Bernard Fusillier is passionate about the coulons

Some like football, walking, cards or cars, but Bernard Fusillier focuses his attention on racing pigeons. Installed near the garden, the tenants of his dovecotes see him several times a day.
He regularly takes a look at his protégés when he does not spend his time cleaning, feeding, training.

Since 50 years

Marconnois by birth, he worked in market gardening with his parents until his marriage in October 1961. Then, he was hired by the Ets Poyer, cattle dealer in Ste-Austreberthe where he made his entire career.
His meeting with Michel Gervois, Francis Devillers and Charles February (who was long-time president of the pigeon society) was decisive. In 1969, he welcomed his first pigeons, birds from farms of the duo Gervois-Devillers. He adheres to the Auchy-les-Hesdin Ramier and to the long courses of President Marcel Loquet to play long distances. "I clean them every day, monitor them, pair them up and train them because they have to be in shape for the competitions that take place from April to August," explains the runner. Like many enthusiasts, he likes to see them return to the dovecote after hundreds of kilometers traveled with wings.

Rewards

All this work allows him to garner prizes and rewards. "He is the oldest pigeon fancier of Ramier," said Guilain Gest, president of the alciaquoise company that can count on him at all events.
"Over the years, I have made a selection and I try to keep the best," says Bernard Fusillier who said "I have never bought pigeons and I remained faithful to the strains from my colleagues Gervois-Devillers ".
In 2011, he received "les ailes d'or" for the regular performances of 3 of his pigeons in 3 long-distance competitions: Saint-Junien, Saint-Vincent and Victoria in Spain. This year, he will receive "the ace pigeon" in one year for having won 10 prizes in 10 competitions (he is ahead of Alexandre Margris de Gennes-Ivergny, a reference in pigeon racing). Reward will be awarded on behalf of the subgroup of St-Pol, where he finishes 10th overall on about 150 members, at the General Assembly of the Ramier November 10.
"Even after 50 years, I'm still motivated to play against the strongest," said Bernard who helped Tanguy Gervois, Michel's grandson, to start in the sport. "I'm happy to see Tanguy win prizes and get good results. He is 5th in the championship of France. Bernard started with Michel Gervois and decades later, he supports Tanguy Gervois, the loop is almost complete. "I had planned to stop but I wonder what I would do without my pigeons. The garden is good but the pigeons are better, "commented Bernard, who will still practice pigeon racing for a few more years.
